sourceDesc.p: Produced from collation output prepared in batch file processing on 2023-06-14 21:19:09.960732 .
Edited to correct alignments and prepared for the Frankenstein Variorum spine on 2023-07-13T16:51:23.434616-04:00.

rdgGrp.n: ['melt the stony hearts of your enemies by my tears and prayers.']
['must die â€“', 'you', 'my companion, my playfellow,', '', 'my more than sisterâ€”', 'die', 'â€“i', 'never']
['shall', 'not', 'die!â€”you,', 'my play-fellow, my companion,', 'my sister, perish on the scaffold! no! no!']

['justine shook her head mournfully. "i do not fear to die," she said; "that pang is past. god raises my weakness, and gives me courage to endure the worst. i leave a sad and bitter world; and if you remember me, and think of me as of one unjustly condemned, i am resigned to the fate awaiting me. learn from me, dear lady, to submit in patience to the will of heaven!"']

['and on the morrow justine died. elizabethâ€™s heart-rending eloquence failed to move the judges from their settled conviction in the criminality of the saintly sufferer. my passionate and indignant appeals were lost upon them. and when i received their cold answers, and heard the harsh unfeeling reasoning of these men, my purposed avowal died away on my lips. thus i might proclaim myself a madman, but not revoke the sentence passed upon my wretched victim. she perished on the scaffold as a murderess!']

['from the tortures of my own heart, i turned to contemplate the deep and voiceless grief of my elizabeth. this also was my doing! and my fatherâ€™s woe, and the desolation of that late so smiling homeâ€”all was the work of my thrice-accursed hands! ye weep, unhappy ones; but these are not your last tears! again shall you raise']

['the funeral wail, and the sound of your lamentations shall again and again be heard! frankenstein, your son, your kinsman, your early, much-loved friend; he who would spend each vital drop of blood for your sakesâ€”who has no thought nor sense of joy, except as it is mirrored also in your dear countenancesâ€”who would fill the air with blessings, and spend his life in serving youâ€”he bids you weepâ€”to shed countless tears; happy beyond his hopes, if thus inexorable fate be satisfied, and if the destruction pause before the peace of the grave have succeeded to your sad torments!']

['<p-start/>', 'thus spoke my prophetic soul, as, torn by remorse, horror, and despair, i beheld those i loved spend vain sorrow upon the graves of william and justine, the first hapless victims to my unhallowed arts.', '<p-end/>']
